ygData.subject: Re: Problem with 64 bit installation
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Harry, I added -fPIC to the make files in fortran and etc/f2c-math directories. Only after it I could overcome the previous problem. However now I met the

Subject: Re: Problem with 64 bit installation

Hi Harry,
I added -fPIC to the make files in fortran and etc/f2c-math
direc=
tories. Only after it I could overcome the previous problem.
However now I =
met the following:

g++ -c cti2ctml.cpp -DHAVE_CONFIG_H 
-I/home/sergey/src=
/cantera/Cantera/src -O3 -Wall
rm -f /home/sergey/src/cantera/build/bin/x86=
_64-unknown-linux-gnu/cti2ctml
g++ -o
/home/sergey/src/cantera/build/bin/x8=
6_64-unknown-linux-gnu/cti2ctml
cti2ctml.o
-L/home/sergey/src/cantera/build=
/lib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu  
-L/usr/lib64 -L/home/sergey/sundials/lib -O=
3 -Wall -luser -loneD
-lzeroD -lcaThermo -ltransport -lcantera -lsundials_c=
vodes
-lsundials_nvecserial -llapack -lblas -lctmath -ltpx -lctf2c
-lconver=
ters  \
               -lctf2c -lm
/usr/lib64/liblapack.so: undefined refer=
ence to `_gfortran_concat_string'
/usr/lib64/liblapack.so: undefined refere=
nce to `_gfortran_st_write_done'
/usr/lib64/liblapack.so: undefined referen=
ce to
`_gfortran_transfer_integer'
/usr/lib64/liblapack.so: undefined refer=
ence to `_gfortran_stop_numeric'
/usr/lib64/liblapack.so: undefined referen=
ce to `_gfortran_pow_i4_i4'
/usr/lib64/liblapack.so: undefined reference to=
 `_gfortran_st_write'
/usr/lib64/liblapack.so: undefined reference to `_gfo=
rtran_copy_string'
/usr/lib64/liblapack.so: undefined reference to `_gfortr=
an_compare_string'
/usr/lib64/liblapack.so: undefined reference to `_gfortr=
an_pow_r8_i4'
/usr/lib64/liblapack.so: undefined reference to
`_gfortran_tr=
ansfer_character'
/usr/lib64/liblapack.so: undefined reference to `_gfortra=
n_pow_r4_i4'
collect2: ld returned 1 exit status
make[2]: ***
[/home/sergey=
/src/cantera/build/bin/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/cti2ctml]
Error 1
make[2]: =
Leaving directory `/home/sergey/src/cantera/tools/src'
make[1]: *** [apps] =
Error 2
make[1]: Leaving directory `/home/sergey/src/cantera/tools'
make: *=
** [utils] Error 2

*****************
It is interesting that all these prob=
lems are only in 64-bit version.
In 32-bit I compiled cantera practically w=
ithout any problems.
Regards.
Sergey.
sergey@conroe:~/src/cantera>         =

>
> Hi Sergey,=

>     Yes, all libraries have to be compiled with the -fPIC option. For
> =
libctmath.a, this means setting the
> FFLAGS environmental variable to some=
thing like FFLAGS=3D'-O -fPIC' on
> input to Cantera's preconfig script.
> =

> Best wishes,
> Harry

> --- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "Moffat, Harry K" <hkmoffa=
@> wrote:
> >
> > Hi Sergey,
> > 
> >   Yes, indeed it appears to be anothe=
r bug, which only happens on a 64
> 
> > bit compile using the full python =
option, at least on my version of 
> > linux. Apparently, the compiler is n=
ow insisting (or perhaps has 
> > always insisted but somehow we got away w=
ith it before) that all code 
> > being linked into a shared library be com=
piled either all with or all 
> > without the -fPIC option. The bug below i=
s due to inconsistent 
> > compilations of different parts of cantera.
> > =

> > After fixing this issue manually, by adding -fPIC to various ext 
> > =
library Makefiles, I was able to compile cantera.so_, make the entire 
> > =
cantera package, and install it. It then passed the full test suite.
> > 
>=
 > Note, however, that to do this for the full python option, I had to 
> >=
 use a 64 bit version of python, that I compiled myself, as the default
> 
=
> > python shipped with my linux os is 32 bit, and therefore would not 
> >=
 work with 64 bit cantera shared libraries. The minimal python option 
> > =
doesn't involve this complexity, because it doesn't use compiled C++
> code=
.
> > 
> > I'll work on modifying the Makefiles, to ensure that a uniform 
=
> > treatment of the -fPIC option is insisted upon, later today.
> > 
> > T=
hanks again Sergey for pointing this bug out.
> > 
> > Best wishes,
> > Har=
ry
> > 
> >
